page.title: 08Salfords Social Club
page.content: {S.C.C.is situated in Mead Avenue- 300 members,mostly family membership from village and surrounding areas. Successful{fete}organised in grounds last year to replace childrens playground equipment.Organising committee formed and 2nd fete took place{May 1985.Raffle}main fund raising event for all local organisations groups and schools- prizes donated by local shops and industries.19 local groups provided stalls/ entertainment and fete was opened by local Radio Mercury Disc Jockey.Farmer Joe Maiklem lent tractor and trailer for procession- May Queen and attendants chosen from local school.Half marathon race started at Monotype and finished at the Social Club- members turned out to support runners.Different events in{Clubhouse each weekend:skittles, discos, pool.
